page.title: 08Housing
page.content: The small village of Keig consists of 8 traditional granite built houses,four blocks of semi-detached cottages built by the County Council (some of which have now been bought by their former tenants) and a number of modern detached houses constructed within the past decade on land bought from Forbes Estate. The mechanisation of farming has resulted in considerable depopulation of the area but the arrival of the "commuter", attracted by the pleasant countryside, the beautiful views and the availability of cottages once occupied by farm workers, has led to the modernisation of many of these cottages and to the building of new houses.
